_header: When Phoebus resplendishant in the high region
_description: Fragment beginning of a Lydgatean love poem — one eight-line stanza

BLHar4999.Transcription:
Whan phebus resplendysaunte in the hye regionand wyth hys goldyn
                    beamys withdre hys lumynareyffrom the cold moysture fr drery scorpyon
                        seassydseassyd I had my lodgyng to rest in
                    sagittaryIntdrew me that tyme all Nid & solytaryfrom compenyes
                    comfort my wyt obnubylatea langoure vnlyste caused me thenghtes to
                    varyeattemptyng my sad mynd thys way to recreate
BLHar4999.Note:
Added by a hand of late fifteenth or sixteenth century to blank page at
                    end of statutes, possibly only the first stanza to a longer poem.
